vocabulary.definition: a statement or proposition that seems self-contradictory or absurd but in reality expresses a possible truth
vocabulary.example: The concept of time travel creates a paradox where you could theoretically change the past to alter the future.

vocabulary.definition: difficult or impossible to understand, explain, or identify
vocabulary.example: The disappearance of the ancient civilization remains a mysterious event in history.

vocabulary.definition: able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
vocabulary.example: Despite facing numerous challenges, the community showed a resilient spirit and rebuilt their homes.
The sudden disappearance of the ship remains a baffling mystery to investigators.

vocabulary.definition: parasites of parasites, organisms that live on or in other parasites
vocabulary.example: The study of hyperparasites reveals a complex ecological relationship within the parasite ecosystem.

vocabulary.definition: the process of working together to the same end
vocabulary.example: Teamwork and cooperation among colleagues are essential for the success of any project.
